sections.title: The challenge with generic Scrum tools
sections.content:
Off-the-shelf Scrum applications offer a one-size-fits-all solution that rarely fits any team perfectly. They often come with overwhelming features you don't need, lack critical functionalities you do, and force your agile practices into their predefined structures.

This leads to compromises in workflow, unnecessary complexity, and a tool that hinders rather than helps your team's agility. With Kliv, you can build a Scrum board that truly aligns with your team's rhythm and ritual.

sections.title: Why build a custom Scrum board?
sections.content:
## Tailored to your agile methodology

Every agile team has its nuances. Whether you're strict Scrum, Scrumban, or a custom hybrid, a generic tool forces you to adapt. A custom board built on Kliv allows you to:

- **Define your own columns**: Differentiate between 'In Progress - Frontend' and 'In Progress - Backend', or add specific 'Code Review' and 'QA Testing' stages.
- **Custom card fields**: Add fields for story points, estimated hours, priority levels, dependencies, or links to technical specifications that are relevant to your projects.
- **Workflow automation**: Implement custom rules for moving cards, notifying team members, or updating status based on your unique definitions of 'done'.

## Unmatched flexibility and control

Standard tools often dictate limitations on reporting, integrations, and user permissions. With your own custom Scrum board, you gain:

- **Granular permissions**: Control who can view, edit, or move cards at a much finer level than off-the-shelf solutions typically allow.
- **Specific integrations**: Connect directly with your code repositories, CI/CD pipelines, customer support systems, or internal communication tools without needing complex workarounds.
- **Data ownership & analytics**: Keep your project data exactly where you want it. Build custom dashboards and reports that highlight the metrics most crucial to your team's performance, not just predefined KPIs.

## Cost-effectiveness in the long run

Subscription fees for popular tools add up, especially as your team grows. A custom solution built with Kliv represents a one-time development investment that offers long-term savings, avoids per-user charges, and ensures you're paying only for features you actually use and value.

## The Kliv advantage for agile teams

Kliv's AI-powered platform makes custom software development accessible. You describe your ideal Scrum process, and Kliv helps build the application. This means:

- **Rapid iteration**: Quickly adjust your board's layout or features based on sprint retrospectives and evolving team needs.
- **Scalability**: Easily add new projects, teams, or adjust for growth without hitting subscription tier limits.
- **Future-proof**: As new agile practices emerge, your custom board can evolve with them, unlike rigid SaaS offerings.

sections.title: Frequently asked questions about building with Kliv

items.answer: The time it takes depends on complexity. A basic Scrum board can be functional in hours. A more sophisticated system with custom reports, integrations, and advanced permissions might take a few days of iterative development.
items.question: How quickly can I build a custom Scrum board?

items.answer: No coding expertise is necessary. Kliv's platform allows you to describe your desired features and workflows using natural language. The AI assists in translating these requirements into a working application.
items.question: Do I need to be a developer to build this?

items.answer: Yes, your custom Scrum board can be designed to integrate with almost any third-party tool that offers an API, including common development tools like Jira, GitHub, Slack, and virtually any internal system.
items.question: Can I integrate my custom board with existing tools like Slack or Git?

items.answer: Absolutely. You maintain full ownership of the application and its data. Kliv provides the platform to build it, but the resulting software is yours to host, modify, and manage as you see fit.
items.question: Will I own the intellectual property of the Scrum board I build?

items.answer: Building a custom solution often results in significant cost savings over time compared to recurring SaaS subscriptions, especially for growing teams. You pay for the development once and avoid per-user fees forever.
items.question: What are the cost implications compared to off-the-shelf Scrum software?

items.answer: Custom-built applications can enhance security by allowing you to control hosting environments, data encryption, and access policies, rather than relying on a third-party vendor's security infrastructure.
items.question: Is a custom Scrum board more secure?

items.answer: Yes. One of the core benefits is the ability to continuously evolve your application. As your team's needs change or new agile methodologies emerge, you can easily modify or add features to your custom board.
items.question: Can I modify my Scrum board after it's been built?

items.answer: Kliv provides AI-powered guidance throughout the development process, including suggestions, debugging, and optimization insights. Since you own the code, you also have the freedom to consult any developer if outside help is ever needed.
